name: Sofitel Lisbon Liberdade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel at the end of our honeymoon in Portugal. We have stayed at Sofitel properties all over the world and this was just ok for us. The carpets are worn and appear dirty. The bathroom was very cramped, although the Hermes products were nice. The bed was comfortable and was just what we were looking for after a long day of sightseeing. Lisbon itself is not at all what we expected...there really isn't that much to do and the city is so poor. Go to Sintra or the Algarve instead. The room was SMALL and room service food was poor. This hotel was average, but if this is one of the top hotels in Lisbon - wow, would I hate to see the rest!!!! Not bad if you are looking for comfortable accomdations for a short stay, but there is no way I could have stayed here more than one night - just too claustrophobic for me.
reviews.title: Just Ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff. We were initially sent to a room still being cleaned. We were immediately sent to the bar by our bellman and welcomed with a glass of Port. The room was very stylish and large by European standards. Great view of the city but also quiet. The bathroom was French! Form over function! A granite counter would be much more useful to the traveler. One of the best showers we have ever had in a hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This really is a good address to stay in lisbon, very central, the rooms had a good size, the bathroom is relatively small but was fabulous with an awesome shower! Very clean. Staff was friendly and everything looked quite new.Only the elevators looked very old, but were in good condition and "retro" is fashionable :-) The only minus point was that on the booking confirmation it said there would be a flatscreen TV in the room, but we only had a normal tube, but that worked fine for us.
reviews.title: What a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Great hotel in the middle of the city. Close to gay life. Very nice rooms with fresh flowers in roon and bathroom.
reviews.title: Fresh flowers

likes.disliked: — Rather small room, no free wifi.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have just returned from a conference in Lisbon where I stayed at the Sofitel, after reading other TripAdvisor reviews. The room was great - quiet, comfortable and welcoming, if not over-large. The Hermes bathroom amenities and indeed the bathroom itself were truly luxurious. The location provided the option of a walk into the old part of the city or the Avenida metro. Free internet access in the business centre was appreciated.
reviews.title: cocooned in comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent two nights here and thought the hotel was excellent. Great location, very comfortable room and bed, nice bathroom, very good breakfast - but above all, really top-notch service from everyone we encountered. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Brilliant service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews about the renovation work I emailed the hotel explaining that we were staying at the hotel for 3 days to celebrate our anniversary and I asked if it would be possible to have a room away from the noise. The hotel emailed to say that they would try to accommodate our request and sure enough we got a room facing the avenue and they also left a complimentary bottle of bubbly and some pastries in our room which was a nice surprise.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: The room had a very large and comfortable bed and a large flat screen TV. The TV only had English news channels but you could pay to view films etc. There were tea and coffee making facilities and a very good quality hairdryer. No iron or ironing board but I am sure that they would have provided them if needed. The bathroom was adequate with plenty of shampoos, body wash etc provided. They also left 1 free bottle of water in the room each day and also a chocolate on the bed when they turned it down each evening. We were on the second floor facing the avenue and there was a little traffic noise day and night and we could hear faint drilling from other areas of the hotel but nothing to worry us. WIFI is free in the rooms and throughout the hotel and we had no problem with connection. Also a safe in the room.
reviews.title: Great service, lovely hotel, good location - but construction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Bar
reviews.title: Awesome service and hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: WE had prepaid for two rooms months ahead of our visit. I was disappointed that we were put on the 3rd floor where from 9AM to 6PM we had to endure construction noise. Higher floors most likely would not have been affected. Since they had our money for months I would have appreciated better accomodations.
reviews.title: 3 night Lisbon stay
Not quite Sofitel Standard...
reviews.text: To be honest this is probably a three to four star Sofitel. Having stayed at a number of Sofitels this isn't quite what you would expect, however by Lisbon standards I am not sure.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The good news is the staff at the bar downstairs are lovely, which is just as well as that is the about the only place with working Internet. The hotel is in a excellent location, short walk to many major areas of interest, shops and food, however is far enough out of the way that beggars and hawkers don't come near the hotel.
reviews.title: Bad Start, Good Finish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: The gym was tiny, so small it wasnt usable at all and shouldn't be advertised as a gym, would have made more sense for Sofitel to arrange for a local full sized gymnasium for guests of which there are a couple nearby. The rooms likewise are small for five star rooms, but are comfortable and clean none of the less, and the cleaning staff do a excellent job with the rooms, including for the evening turn down service - so recognition needs to be given to house keeping staff.
reviews.title: Affordable luxury in the very heart of Lisboa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wifi in the hotel was appalling, spent hours logging back in, getting kicked off, disconnected, and while it was free it was unusable - would prefer a fee for a working wifi. Likewise small requests like asking for a iron (as there are none in the room) were met with the feeling you are causing a hassle.
reviews.title: Best bed ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at Sofitel for just 2 night and it was a great experience! The staff is very friendly, the frontdesk girl name Claudia was very nice to us, and gave us a map with the most important things to view, as we had only one day. The breakfast is not cheap but is very good. Good location, near to shops and metro stations.
reviews.title: Would stay here again and again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great room, awesome bed. Would stay here again!
reviews.title: best hotel in our trip to Portugal and Germany.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel with very large and confortable room and bed. Excellent service, staff and breakfast. Special toiletries, bathrobe and slippers. Free wi-fi access. In a walking distance from Rossio and Baixa, with easy access to the main sights. I will be looking forward to my next stay in this hotel.
reviews.title: Modern contemporary style hotel with excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Out first time in Lisbon and having researched numerous hotels on TA, felt that this was the right one for us - and we weren't disappointed. The welcome on arrival by the Reception staff was warm and helpful. Having had a bad experience with an airport taxi driver who had atempted to grossly overcharge, the reception staff were sympathetic and reassuring.
reviews.title: Outstanding service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Check-in was prompt and we were immediately shown to our room
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I booked the Sofitel with a really good price. Nice atmosphere and the bed is really good with a stylish bath. The breakfast has been included, but it is not the big difference to other accor hotels.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, very central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: Wireless connection in the room is bad, it works often, but sometimes no signal. They should fix that, because at this hotel standard it is a "must". 50 EUR per week for Internet is a bit funny.
reviews.title: Just Superb !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is good here and you will really enjoy your trip.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

likes.disliked: — Room window did not open properly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms toward the street are a bit loud. But it is very central located and the next tube station is in front of the door.
reviews.title: Great Central Hotel

likes.liked: — comfatable, clean, nice decor, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed with my husband from July 12 until July 16 and all I have to say is that evreything was perfect. The room was on the 7th floor facing Avenida Liberdade. It was very clean and cosy with view to the St.Jorge Castle. The bed is one of the best I've ever slept. The decoration of the room and generally of the whole hotel is attractive, easy to use, and functions well with the existing architecture.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights in the Sofitel Lisbon Liberdade. Location of the hotel is excellent (along the main artery of the city). The hotel exterior is rather unremarkable and a bit "dated" but when you walk into the hotel, you will note that it is a very modern, well furnished and very well maintained property. I would not however rate it as a "Five Star" Hotel as it does lack some essential facilities such as a pool and it has only one restaurant.
reviews.title: A Gem of a Hotel in Lisbon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was large and comfortable. The bed was excellent. Bathroom was a bit too small but still manageable. Excellent housekeeping standards are maintained.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Location, Stellar Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge was very helpful and they were most kind to "remember" that it was my birthday and gave me a free birthday cake! That was a real surprise and a lovely and considerate touch!
reviews.title: The Best in Lisboa...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: All in all, I would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone visiting Lisbon though the rates are rather pricey for Portugal.
reviews.title: Perfect choise for a small trip to the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 3 night anniversary treat at the Sofitel was excellent.
reviews.title: Stylish Sofitel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location. The bus and metro stops right outside give easy access to Lisbon's public transport system. The hotel is only a 10 minute walk from the city centre and close to one of the 'elevadors' to the Barrio Alto.
reviews.title: Great hotel, well located

likes.disliked: — Recommended restaurants given by front desk

reviews.title: A bling-bling hotel for a bling-bling era
reviews.text: Hotel staff were friendly, helpful and efficient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel's public areas are stylish. We had a standard room at the rear of the hotel. The room, which had a partial view of the Bario Alto, was quite small. The slightly cramped feeling was not helped by a very large, but extremely comfortable, bed and a large cabinet containing the TV.
reviews.title: Dreamy Sofitel Lisboa
Nice hotel, great location
reviews.text: Breakfast was a mixture of an extensive self-service buffet and cooked to order bacon, eggs, etc. How nice to be served a cafetiere of coffee instead of having to ask for 'top ups'.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our first stay in Lisbon and our first at a Sofitel. We are delighted with our choice. The hotel is very well located near to the centre of Lisbon and also handy for Rossio station which is where trains for Sintra depart from. We had one double and one single room- both were well appointed beautifully kept and with exceptionally comfortable beds. Wifi was free and worked well. We booked breakfast too and were very pleased with it. There was an extensive buffet and eggs were offered as part of the buffet rate but cooked freshly to order.
reviews.title: comfort and convenience at Sofitel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly recommend this Sofitel.
reviews.title: Very nice
Honeymoon In Lisbon
reviews.text: Beautiful room albeit small. Staff was very kind and helpful, never pushy. My only complaint is that the street side rooms are quite noisy early in the morning. We would definitely stay at this hotel again but I would request a room on the backside of the hotel..

reviews.title: Good location, friendly staff but didn't try to right a wrong....
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sofitel in Lisbon for a portion of our Honeymoon in Portugal and couldn't be happier with our choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Although the hotel decoration is really confusing (golden walls with red vases and colourful painting all around) their staff is extremely nice and helpful. The room is very comfortable (specially the fluffy bed) and breakfast is delicious, not to mention the amazing location.
reviews.title: Nice friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Old and stuffy rooms, very slow check in and construction going on in the courtyard...
reviews.title: old and stuffy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can not commend on breakfast or service but apart from its location I don't see much in favour of the sofitel. Will not come back
reviews.title: A truly delightful experience in the heart of Lisbon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: I and my fiancée spent four nights at the Sofitel Lisbon Liberdade last March, and we must say this is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Disappointed with this Sofitel. Not a 5 star (maybe not even 4)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived before noon, to an efficient check-in and a short wait until our room was ready and we were handed the keys to our Prestige Suite. And what a suite! A bedroom with a separate living room, two bathrooms with plenty of Hermés items, spacious desks and closets, not to forget the fine, upscale decoration and perfect cleanliness. Oh, and a bouquet of fresh, beautifully arranged red roses were there to welcome my fiancée in our romantic escapade, as well as an assortment of fresh fruits for our stay.
reviews.title: Do you want drilling and hammering with that?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I can confirm the very favourable comments that have been made on this hotel. The interiour design of the hotel produces a comfortable and cosy atmosphere. The rooms, breakfast area, bar, entrance hall are decorated nicely. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is perfect to explore the old town. Breakfast is delicious. The stay in the hotel contributed largely to pleasant impressions from my trip to Lisbon.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The only critical remark is that when I arrived at the hotel not all staff at the front desk was skilful to allocate rooms according to the preferences of the guests.
reviews.title: There is a reason this hotel is rated so high!
Nice Room, Good Value
reviews.text: Although my review may not be as detailed as others it is imperative I write this. I was given the task of finding more than suitable accomodations for my parents on their visit to Lisbon. They were visiting for a very special event and know I think i have received the title of their "favourite" for the time being. They were upgraded to a suite, and from start to finish they compared this to a second honeymoon. The room was "dreamy" and the service was to die for. If you visit Lisboa please stay here to make your journey legendary!!!

reviews.title: luxurious hotel in nice location
reviews.text: I stayed in Lisbon a couple of years ago in the Holiday Inn Continental and decided this time to go for something more central and avoid tuve rides. The hotel is pretty central but can still be a trek to say the castle or the water front and it you don't take the venicular it's a hike to the Barrio Alto. Having said that I can't think of any alternate location that would be much more beneficial.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free internet access on hotel computers is not comon in hotels I have stayed in, so this was very handy. It is not so much the cost as the convenience.
reviews.title: LISBON ON YOUR DOORSTEP

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyday we were welcomed by a smile, and a very high standard of service. The beds are the best in class, and provide great comfort and support. Service was excellent, I would recommend the hotel to everyone.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel, nice rooms, beds and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was great, a very nicely presented fruit and continental buffer. Next to this very polite staff which brought coffee and eggs. Again, as to be expected from a Sofitel!
reviews.title: Good Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel over Easter. I called ahead to ensure we would get a room facing the road and away from the construction noise. We had a good stay overall.
reviews.title: If you're at the front of the hotel, it's perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Room:
reviews.title: Avoid the back, avoid the renovation noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was the standard room, it was spacious enough and felt well maintained. I love dark rooms so the room suited me well! The bathroom was also nice and spacious. We asked for toothpaste and a couple other items brought up to the room and they were very quick. Only comment is that the hot water was at times was boiling hot and look a while to cool down to normal temperature.
reviews.title: Dark & Noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Style, cleanliness and general quality of the hotel were excellent, location is ideal. Everyone we had dealings with from the bell boys to the front desk, cleaners and bar staff were extraordinarily helpful. Fantastic weekend break.
reviews.title: Impossible to fault
Excellent
reviews.text: Very comfortable room and bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Service excellent and breakfast more than enough
reviews.title: Perfect in every respect.............
A brand you can trust
reviews.text: Everything was brilliant from the moment we stepped into the hotel. This was a surprise

description: This 5 star lavish hotel consists of 163 extravagantly decorated rooms with a shower of modern glamour. All rooms are equipped with the most diversified services which define the quality and comfort that our guests appreciate. These may include: LCD, mini-bar, coffee machine and a flower bouquet which gives the room a unique atmosphere of lux and comfort. At Sofitel Lisbon Liberdade you will surely receive a prestigious service provided by our multi-lingual ambassadors and Concierge Clé d’Or, free access to wireless internet, a fitness centre which provides the most essential equipment, and a pleasant library connected to the bar where you can find a selection of paintings from the Beijing School of Arts and an international collection of books, newspapers and magazines. Seminars and conferences can be accommodated in the hotel's ten meeting rooms, the largest of which can seat up to 250 people. The guests may also benefit from 24h Business Centre and Room Service, as well parking facilities (surcharges apply) and complimentary valet-parking services.
